meanings.definition: A type of head covering worn by ancient Greek women.
meanings.sent1: In ancient Greece, women often wore a kalyptras to keep their heads warm.
meanings.sent2: The kalyptras was an essential part of the traditional Greek attire for women.
meanings.sent3: The kalyptras flew off in the strong wind, causing laughter among the onlookers.
meanings.sent4: Her kalyptras of wisdom shielded her from the harsh realities of life.
meanings.sent5: The intricate design of the kalyptras made it a symbol of elegance and grace.

meanings.definition: A covering or hood used to protect delicate plant parts.
meanings.sent1: The gardener placed a kalyptras over the fragile flower buds to shield them from frost.
meanings.sent2: The kalyptras kept the young saplings safe from the harsh sunlight.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to steal the kalyptras, thinking it was a tasty treat.
meanings.sent4: The kalyptras of leaves provided a cozy shelter for the tiny insects.
meanings.sent5: The colorful kalyptras added a touch of beauty to the garden while protecting the plants.

meanings.definition: A type of decorative cover for a chalice or other vessel.
meanings.sent1: The priest carefully placed the kalyptras over the sacred chalice during the ceremony.
meanings.sent2: The intricate patterns on the kalyptras added a touch of elegance to the simple vessel.
meanings.sent3: The kalyptras slipped from the chalice, causing a moment of panic during the ritual.
meanings.sent4: The golden kalyptras shimmered under the candlelight, enhancing the beauty of the ceremony.
meanings.sent5: The ancient kalyptras was believed to bring blessings and protection to the vessel it covered.
